intro: Spilanthes ocoxiuhitl, commonly known as the Mexican toothache plant, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the genus Spilanthes within the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its yellowish-orange flowers and pungent, peppery scent. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported pain-relieving properties. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
